newsitem.title: SPAIN: Catalan spokesman presses for lower Spanish rates.
newsitem.headline: Catalan spokesman presses for lower Spanish rates.

text.p: Catalan spokesman Francesc Homs told a local television station Monday official rates needed to be below six percent in the next few months if Spain was to reach its European goals.
The Bank of Spain cut its leading money market rate to 6.75 percent from 7.25 percent last Thursday, the Bank's sixth reduction this year.
The minority Popular Party government has pledged to join the European common currency at its launch in 1999.

"If we want to fulfill the Maastricht Treaty, then interest rates should be below six percent in the next months," Homs, a spokesman for Catalonian's Convergence and Union, told Europa Press Television at the fringe of a seminar in Barcelona.
Homs welcomed the central bank's move last week but said "We hope this change isn't the last. Spain needs to lower rates and it has to do it in the next months."
